definition: tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)

sentences.english: On Tuesday morning a truck stopped at the mailbox.
sentences.chinese: 星期二一早，一輛卡車停在郵筒旁。

sentences.english: There is a pillar box at the street corner.
I dropped the letter in the mailbox on this corner.
sentences.chinese: 我把信投到了街角的郵筒裏。

sentences.english: Juan put the letter in the mailbox on Monday night.
sentences.chinese: 星期一晚上，胡安把信放進了郵筒。

sentences.english: Colossal . She looks like a mailbox.
sentences.chinese: 大錯特錯她看起來像一個郵筒。

sentences.english: Nearly identical credit card offers from competing banks fill up mailboxes .
sentences.chinese: 幾乎同一的信用卡從競爭銀行提供裝滿郵筒。

sentences.english: "You've got to check the mailbox every day, " said Molly 36 to Dad.
sentences.chinese: “你要每天都查看郵筒哦”毛麗什麼地和爸爸說。

sentences.english: Thus, the mail box is always full in the time leading up to Valentine's Day each year.
sentences.chinese: 因此這個郵筒在每年的情人節期間都被塞得滿滿的。

sentences.english: The suet puddings and the red pillar-boxes have entered into your soul.
sentences.chinese: 板油布丁和紅色郵筒已經深入你的靈魂。

sentences.english: You just stick a stamp on the postcard and put it in the mailbox over there.
sentences.chinese: 貼張郵花再扔到前邊那個郵筒裏就可以了。
她封上信封后把信放入郵筒。

sentences.english: Please put mail into this mail box if you wanna send mail to Santa.
sentences.chinese: 如果想寄信給聖誕老公公，請用這個郵筒。

sentences.english: Why did you hit that mailbox anyway?
sentences.chinese: 你究竟是怎麼撞上那郵筒的？

sentences.english: Can you put these letters into the pillar-box for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能幫我把這些信投入郵筒嗎？

sentences.english: Dave lives in Oregon. Juan put the letter in the mailbox on Monday night.
sentences.chinese: 星期一晚上，胡安把信放進了郵筒。

definition: to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
